text: XHPR-FM in Veracruz, Veracruz is a Mexican radio station broadcasting on 101.7 MHz. It is known as La Nueva Soy 101.7 and carries a Tropical format. ==History== XHPR's last logo under Grupo FM ownership XHPR began operations on 101.3 MHz some time after receiving its concession in 1965. It was owned by Emmy Pinto Reyes, who also obtained the original concession for XHEM-FM in Ciudad Juárez. The station moved to 101.7 MHz in 2003 (though authorization was given in May 2005)RPC: Concession Renewal for XHPR-FM Veracruz in order to avoid interference to other radio stations. In 2016, a sale to Grupo Radio Digital by the previous owners, Grupo FM Multimedios, prompted a format change to Ke Buena, which lasted just months before another format change, back to pop. The station has been known as Pop FM, Soy Pop FM, and currently La Nueva Soy 101.7 since returning to the format. ==References== Category:Radio stations in Veracruz
title: XHPR-FM (Veracruz, Veracruz)
